Those changes in its condition meant the reorganization plan previously presented to creditors would have to be revamped .

Eastern Airlines ' creditors committee , unhappy with the carrier 's plans for emerging from bankruptcy - law proceedings , asked its own experts to devise alternate approaches to a reorganization . Representatives of the accounting firm of Ernst & Young and the securities firm of Goldman , Sachs & Co. , hired by creditors to consult on Eastern 's financial plans , told the committee in a private meeting yesterday that Eastern 's latest plan to emerge from bankruptcy - law protection is far riskier than an earlier one which won the creditors ' approval .

Even network executives , however , admit privately that victory -- either in Congress or in talks with the studios -- is highly doubtful any time soon .
